title: Operations Engineer Intern, EVF at Sanofi Global (English)
description: Learn more about applying for Operations Engineer Intern, EVF at Sanofi Global (English)
cleaned_text: Operations Engineer Intern, EVF About the job Our Company: Sanofi is preparing its future through an ambitious program named EVolutive Facility (EVF). Located in Tuas Biomedical park, the Evolutive Facility will be a first-of-its-kind, fully digitalized, modular vaccine manufacturing facility. It will be capable of producing vaccines on a large scale for Asia. Main responsibilities: The Manufacturing Digital Solutions Engineer Intern will: Collaborate with Manufacturing 4.0, Digital, Engineering, Operations, and Quality teams in the design, implementation, testing and deployment of digital applications supporting the Manufacturing operations (Manufacturing Execution Systems, Historian) Work with other computerized systems to support their integration with MES and Historian (DCS, SAP, etc) Create Standard Operating Procedures (SOP) and training materials to support and use of MES and Historian Ensure compliance with cGMP as well as all Sanofi Quality requirements. Learning Outcomes At the end of the internship, you will: Be part of the multi-cultural and diverse pioneering group in Sanofi working towards the goal of implementing digital systems to support the ambition of having a paperless manufacturing process. Have a strong exposure to the life sciences industry and the related requirements in Operations, Digital and HSE. About you Technical skills: Eager to work with fully digital tools: Manufacturing control system / MES / paperless systems Prior experience (including internships) in a manufacturing facility will be an advantage. Soft skills: Ability to work in multi-disciplinary and multicultural team / Excellent communication ability / Team spirit Self-organized and Independent Proficient in spoken and written English, with a keen eye for detail Sanofi Behaviors and Skills This position is required to demonstrate behaviors such as Stretch, Put the interest of the organization, Act in the interest of our patients and customers and Take Action. During the interview we will also be asking for examples of skills such as Strategic Thinking, Result Orientation, People Leadership (if applicable), Relationship and Influence. Pursue progress, discover extraordinary Better is out there. Better medications, better outcomes, better science. But progress doesn't happen without people - people from different backgrounds, in different locations, doing different roles, all united by one thing: a desire to make miracles happen. So, let's be those people.
